content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.19 - Executive order no. 19: discontinuing access by the citizens' utility board to state agency mailings

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the State of New York has assigned the
responsibility of representing the interests of utility ratepayers in utility
matters to several State agencies, including the Department of Public Service, Consumer Protection Board and Department of Law; WHEREAS, the citizens of the State of New York pay the
expenses of these State agencies, including the costs of representing utility
ratepayers in utility matters; WHEREAS, access by private organizations to State agency
mailings imposes additional administrative burdens and costs on State
government at an additional cost to taxpayers and this duplicates the
contributions made to the expenses of the State agencies that represent
ratepayers in utility matters; WHEREAS, utility ratepayers have formed private
associations to represent their interests in utility matters before State
agencies and the work of these associations is an effective and direct method
of advancing such interests; WHEREAS, it is the policy of this State to foster and
encourage multiple and diverse associations of utility ratepayers in utility
matters to have access to the regulatory process in order to encourage the
consideration of the multiple interests represented by these
associations; WHEREAS, the Citizens' Utility Board, one of the entities
representing the interests of utility customers, has had access to State agency
mailings; and
WHEREAS, the provisions of special State privileges
providing access to State agency mailings to only one consumer entity is
contrary to the State's policy of encouraging multiple and diverse associations
and allowing citizens the opportunity of direct access to State
government; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby order as follows: 1. Executive Order Number 141, dated January
3, 1991, is revoked and superseded by this Executive Order. 2. The access provided to the Citizens'
Utility Board by the Executive Order revoked herein to State agency mailings is
hereby discontinued, effective immediately. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: October 25, 1995
